p: Implementing measures for the Statute for Members of the European Parliament
Bureau Decision of 4 May 2009 on language and computer courses for Members.
This appropriation is intended to cover the cost of language and IT courses for Members.
This appropriation is intended to cover the purchase
column14: including the purchase of ergonomic furniture
column15: the replacement of worn-out and broken furniture and office machines. It is also intended to cover miscellaneous expenditure on managing the European Parliament’s furniture stock.

p: In connection with works of art
p lang: this appropriation is intended to cover both the cost of acquiring and purchasing specific material and the current expenditure relating thereto
column18: insurance and ad hoc transport costs.

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 5 000.
This appropriation is intended to cover charges for postage
p lang: processing and delivery by national postal services or private delivery firms.

p: This appropriation is also intended to cover mail-handling services.
The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 5 000.
Staff Regulations of Officials of the European Union
p lang: and in particular Article 71 thereof and Articles 11

p: This appropriation is intended to cover expenditure on duty travel by staff of the institution
p lang: seconded national experts and trainees between place of employment and any of the European Parliament’s three places of work (Brussels
column13: Luxembourg and Strasbourg) and on missions to any location other than the three places of work. Expenditure is made up of transport costs
column15: accommodation costs and compensatory allowances for unsocial hours. Ancillary costs (including cancellation of tickets and hotel reservations
column16: electronic invoicing costs and mission insurance costs) are also covered.

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 360 000.
